summary.incident:
Matty Cash (Aston Villa) can count himself
lucky for not being sent off after only
receiving a caution from the referee.

Marco Bizot (Aston Villa) is given a fully
deserved yellow card.

Goal! Jean-Philippe Mateta (Crystal Palace)
wins the battle of wills and sends an unstoppable
penalty past Marco Bizot into the bottom
left corner.

This is a yellow card! Jean-Philippe Mateta
(Crystal Palace) is not happy with the decision,
but from our point of view it was clear.

Unai Emery makes a switch. Emiliano Buendia
is coming on in place of Evann Guessand
(Aston Villa) at the start of the second
period.

This yellow card was deserved. The tackle
by Will Hughes (Crystal Palace) was quite
harsh and Stuart Attwell didn't hesitate
to show him a yellow card.

Oliver Glasner is forced to make a change.
Adam Wharton is not able to carry on due
to injury. He is replaced by Jefferson Lerma
(Crystal Palace).

Marc Guehi (Crystal Palace) finds some space
on the edge of the penalty box and smashes
the ball into the top right corner! What
a beauty!

Substitution. Will Hughes did his best and
is replaced by Yeremy Pino (Crystal Palace).

Unai Emery has decided to substitute Matty
Cash and he is replaced by Bradley-Paul
Burrowes (Aston Villa).

That will be all from John McGinn who is
being replaced by the fresh legs of Pau
Torres (Aston Villa).

GOAL! The long throw finds Maxence Lacroix
and his headed flick on is easily nodded
into the net from close range by Ismaila
Sarr (Crystal Palace). It's now 0:3.

Substitution. Lucas Digne (Aston Villa)
in, Donyell Malen out.

Unai Emery has decided to make a change.
Lamare Bogarde (Aston Villa) replaces Ian
Maatsen.

Here comes a substitution. Jean-Philippe
Mateta is given a rest as he is replaced
by Justin Devenny (Crystal Palace).

We are about to witness a substitution.
Nathaniel Clyne (Crystal Palace) is replacing
Daichi Kamada.

Ismaila Sarr (Crystal Palace) is booked
after bringing down an opponent. Stuart
Attwell had an easy-decision to make.

Mikel Arteta is forced to make an unplanned
substitution as William Saliba (Arsenal)
suffers an injury and Cristhian Mosquera
comes on.

The foul by Ryan Gravenberch (Liverpool)
is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly
shown by Chris Kavanagh.

We are about to witness a substitution.
Curtis Jones (Liverpool) is replacing Alexis
Mac Allister.

Viktor Gyökeres (Arsenal) sees a yellow
card from Chris Kavanagh after he sent one
of the opposing players to the ground.

The referee signals that it is time for
a substitution and Martin Odegaard (Arsenal)
is coming onto the pitch as Mikel Merino
cannot continue after picking up an injury.

Mikel Arteta prepares a substitution. Gabriel
Martinelli is replaced by Eberechi Eze (Arsenal).

The referee stops play so that a substitution
can be made and Hugo Ekitike departs the
field of play to be replaced by Federico
Chiesa (Liverpool).

The manager has been forced to make a substitution
and the injured Ibrahima Konate limps off
the pitch to be replaced by Joe Gomez (Liverpool).

Chris Kavanagh shows the yellow card to
Martin Zubimendi (Arsenal) for a heavy challenge.

Dominik Szoboszlai (Liverpool) proved his
free kick skills, especially from this distance.
He hits the ball perfectly, putting it in
off the left post and leaving the goalkeeper
no chance at all.

Arne Slot is forced to make a change. Florian
Wirtz is not able to carry on due to injury.
He is replaced by Wataru Endo (Liverpool).

That's the end of the game for Noni Madueke,
who is replaced by Max Dowman (Arsenal).

Chris Kavanagh shows a yellow card to Wataru
Endo (Liverpool) for a tough tackle.
Jan Paul van Hecke (Brighton) is yellow-carded.

Goal! Omar Marmoush manages to prod the
ball to Erling Haaland (Manchester City)
after a melee inside the box, and he needs
no second invitation to slot the ball into
the right side of the goal. 0:1.

The manager makes a subsitution with James
Milner (Brighton) coming on for Carlos Baleba.

Fabian Hurzeler has decided to substitute
Jack Hinshelwood and he is replaced by Yasin
Ayari (Brighton).

A substitution has been made. Danny Welbeck
goes off and Georginio Rutter (Brighton)
comes on.

Fabian Hurzeler has decided to introduce
fresh legs, with Brajan Gruda (Brighton)
replacing Diego Gomez.

Abdukodir Khusanov (Manchester City) receives
a yellow card from the referee as expected.

Goal! James Milner (Brighton) wins the battle
of wills and sends an unstoppable penalty
past James Trafford into the bottom left
corner.

This yellow card was deserved. The tackle
by Rayan Ait Nouri (Manchester City) was
quite harsh and Darren England didn't hesitate
to show him a yellow card.

Omar Marmoush goes off the pitch and Jeremy
Doku (Manchester City) comes on.

Here is a change. Bernardo Silva is going
off and Pep Guardiola gives the last tactical
orders to Nico O'Reilly (Manchester City).

The referee is firm and issues Joel Veltman
(Brighton) a deserved yellow card.

Rico Lewis (Manchester City) joins the action
as a substitute, replacing Matheus Nunes.

Problems for Pep Guardiola as Abdukodir
Khusanov (Manchester City) is not able to
play anymore. His injury is too serious
and Ruben Dias replaces him.

Brajan Gruda (Brighton) runs on to a clever
pass from Kaoru Mitoma and finds himself
one-on-one with the keeper. He still has
work to do but finishes with aplomb into
the back of the net.

Fabian Hurzeler is forced to make a change.
Yankuba Minteh (Brighton) is not able to
carry on due to injury. He is replaced by
Diego Coppola.

Nuno Espirito Santo has decided to make
a change. James McAtee (Nottingham) replaces
Dan Ndoye.

Graham Potter has decided to introduce fresh
legs, with Callum Wilson (West Ham) replacing
Niclas Fullkrug.

That will be all from Chris Wood who is
being replaced by the fresh legs of Igor
Jesus (Nottingham).

Graham Potter prepares a substitution. James
Ward-Prowse is replaced by Andrew Irving
(West Ham).

Jarrod Bowen (West Ham) strikes the ball
towards goal from the edge of the penalty
box and it goes straight inside the left
post!

GOAL! That’s a great strike from the spot
by Lucas Paqueta (West Ham) low into the
left of the net, giving goalkeeper Matz
Sels no chance!

The substitution has been made. Omari Hutchinson
(Nottingham) has replaced Callum Hudson-Odoi.

Nuno Espirito Santo decides to make a substitution.
Ibrahim Sangare will be replaced by Arnaud
Kalimuendo (Nottingham).

Goal – 0:3! El Hadji Malick Diouf sends
a superb cross into the box. Callum Wilson
(West Ham) latches on to it and from near
the penalty spot powers a header into the
top right corner, leaving Matz Sels beaten.
He displayed his eye for goal there - excellent
finish.

Nick Pope (Newcastle Utd) infringed the
rules and goes into the book. Peter Bankes
pulls out a yellow card.

Wilfried Gnonto (Leeds) is awarded a yellow
card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to
agree with the decision, but Peter Bankes
ignores the protests.

Substitution. Lewis Miley (Newcastle Utd)
receives a signal from the referee and is
now allowed to enter the pitch as Jacob
Ramsey walks off.

Daniel Farke has decided to make a change.
Brenden Aaronson (Leeds) replaces Daniel
James.

Substitution. Wilfried Gnonto leaves the
pitch and is replaced by Jack Harrison (Leeds).

The referee signals that it is time for
a substitution and Lewis Hall (Newcastle
Utd) is coming onto the pitch as Kieran
Trippier cannot continue after picking up
an injury.

Substitution. Anthony Elanga (Newcastle
Utd) in, Jacob Murphy out.

Here is a change. Sven Botman is going off
and Eddie Howe gives the last tactical orders
to Harvey Barnes (Newcastle Utd).

We are about to witness a substitution.
Dominic Calvert-Lewin (Leeds) is replacing
Lukas Nmecha.

The referee stops play so that a substitution
can be made and James Justin (Leeds) comes
onto the pitch for Gabriel Gudmundsson.

Josh Cullen (Burnley) scores an unfortunate
own goal after deflecting the ball into
his own net!

The referee stops play so that a substitution
can be made and Joshua Zirkzee (Manchester
United) comes onto the pitch for Matheus
Cunha.

Ruben Amorim makes a half-time substitution.
Kobbie Mainoo (Manchester United) comes
on in place of Mason Mount.

Lyle Foster (Burnley) gets on the end of
a long pass that is slotted through the
defence and easily sends the ball into the
bottom left corner!

Goal - 2:1! Diogo Dalot laid the ball off
to Bryan Mbeumo (Manchester United), who
shot from close range low into the back
of the net, leaving the goalkeeper helpless.

Substitution. Loum Tchaouna (Burnley) on
for Hannibal Mejbri.

Goal! Jaidon Anthony (Burnley) fires the
rebound into the middle of the goal after
the ball breaks to him in the box. The score
is 2:2.

We are about to witness a substitution.
Benjamin Sesko (Manchester United) is replacing
Casemiro.

Scott Parker has decided to make a change.
Josh Laurent (Burnley) replaces Lesley Ugochukwu.

Bruno Fernandes (Manchester United) is literally
asking for a yellow card with his behaviour.
The referee agrees and books him.

Substitution. Jacob Bruun Larsen walks off
the pitch and Oliver Sonne (Burnley) comes
on as a substitute.

Here is a change. Hjalmar Ekdal is going
off and Scott Parker gives the last tactical
orders to Joe Worrall (Burnley).

The referee stops play so that a substitution
can be made and Leny Yoro trots off the
pitch and is replaced by Noussair Mazraoui
(Manchester United).

Loum Tchaouna (Burnley) gets a yellow card.
The referee Samuel Barrott made the right
call.

The foul by Jaidon Anthony (Burnley) is
worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown
by Samuel Barrott.

The main referee, Samuel Barrott, is apparently
not going to tolerate any discussions. Lyle
Foster (Burnley) is given a yellow card
for dissent.

Goal! Bruno Fernandes (Manchester United)
wins the battle of wills and sends an unstoppable
penalty past Martin Dubravka into the bottom
left corner.

Josh Laurent (Burnley) says more than he
should have to the referee and is shown
a yellow card.

Kyle Walker (Burnley) attempts to discuss
the decision with Samuel Barrott, but he
soon realises that it's not the right thing
to do as he sees the yellow.

Celebrations are cut short for Brentford
as the referee indicates NO GOAL after the
VAR review shows it was offside!

Today's referee Anthony Taylor rightly decides
to book Reinildo Mandava (Sunderland) for
his harsh tackle.

Habib Diarra (Sunderland) sees a yellow!
His tackle wasn't that harsh, but he probably
talked himself into Anthony Taylor's book.

Penalty saved! Kevin Schade (Brentford)
sends the penalty towards the bottom left
corner, but Robin Roefs pulls off a wonderful
save to deny him.

Anthony Taylor shows the yellow card to
Igor Thiago (Brentford) for a heavy challenge.

Substitution. Simon Adingra (Sunderland)
has come on for Chemsdine Talbi.

Regis Le Bris has decided to substitute
Eliezer Mayenda and he is replaced by Wilson
Isidor (Sunderland).

Substitution. Frank Onyeka (Brentford) receives
a signal from the referee and is now allowed
to enter the pitch as Jordan Henderson walks
off.

Substitution. Keane Lewis-Potter did his
best and is replaced by Rico Henry (Brentford).

Igor Thiago (Brentford) finds some space
inside the box and scores with a crashing
header into the middle of the net, giving
the goalkeeper no chance.

A yellow card for a tackle by Rico Henry
(Brentford). Anthony Taylor doesn't hesitate
at all to make this decision.

Goal! Enzo Le Fee (Sunderland) takes just
a short run up and buries the penalty into
the bottom right corner.

The referee signals a substitution. Marc
Guiu (Sunderland) is brought on as a substitute
for Habib Diarra.

Keith Andrews has decided to make a change.
Fabio Carvalho (Brentford) replaces Kevin
Schade.

Anthony Taylor shows a yellow card to Granit
Xhaka (Sunderland), who isn't surprised
as the tackle was really hard and late.

Wilson Isidor (Sunderland) leaps to connect
with a lovely cross and scores with a header
that bounces off the ground and goes inside
the left post. The goalkeeper had no chance
to make a save.

home_team:
Hjelde L. F.
Achilles Tendon Injury

summary.incident:
Goal! Marcos Senesi plays a long ball to
Evanilson (Bournemouth), who cuts inside
and unleashes a screamer into the right
of the goal. The keeper had no chance. Superb
strike! 0:1.

Antoine Semenyo (Bournemouth) gives the
referee no choice but to show him a yellow
card.

Micky van de Ven (Tottenham) is booked after
bringing down an opponent. Simon Hooper
had an easy-decision to make.

The manager has been forced to make a substitution
and the injured Adam Smith leaves the pitch
to be replaced by James Hill (Bournemouth).

It's time for a substitution. Wilson Odobert
(Tottenham) comes on in place of Brennan
Johnson.

Thomas Frank has decided to make a change.
Lucas Bergvall (Tottenham) replaces Joao
Palhinha.

Here is a change. Alex Scott is going off
and Andoni Iraola gives the last tactical
orders to Ryan Christie (Bournemouth).

Substitution. David Brooks walks off the
pitch and Amine Adli (Bournemouth) comes
on as a substitute.

Simon Hooper shows a yellow card to Djed
Spence (Tottenham) for his blatant foul.

It's time for a substitution. That's the
last involvement from Pedro Porro as he
is replaced by Destiny Udogie (Tottenham).

Djordje Petrovic (Bournemouth) receives
a yellow card from the referee as expected.

Substitution. Mathys Tel (Tottenham) in,
Pape Matar Sarr out.

Andoni Iraola has decided to substitute
Evanilson and he is replaced by Justin Kluivert
(Bournemouth).

The referee stops play so that a substitution
can be made and Marcus Tavernier trots off
the pitch and is replaced by Eli Junior
Kroupi (Bournemouth).

Tyler Adams (Bournemouth) is awarded a yellow
card for his behaviour.
James Hill (Bournemouth) is yellow-carded.

GOAL! Beto (Everton) scores with a header
from close range after Jack Grealish headed
a pin-point lofted cross into his path.
It's 0:1.

The foul by Kiernan Dewsbury-Hall (Everton)
is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly
shown by Michael Oliver.

Goal! Marshall Munetsi displays great vision
and sends a pass to Hee-Chan Hwang (Wolves),
who shows brilliant composure inside the
box to bury the ball inside the right post.
The score is 1:1.

It's in the back of the net! Kiernan Dewsbury-Hall
sprays a pass out to Iliman Ndiaye (Everton),
and he has an easy job to slot the ball
into an empty net. The score is 1:2.

Jack Grealish passes the ball into the penalty
area. Kiernan Dewsbury-Hall (Everton) collects
it and quickly sends it into the top left
corner via the post! The goalkeeper was
helpless. 1:3!

The referee signals a substitution. Rodrigo
Gomes (Wolves) is brought on as a substitute
for Andre.

The manager has decided to make a substitution
and Jackson Tchatchoua walks off the pitch
to be replaced by Fernando Lopez (Wolves).

Vitor Pereira has decided to make a change.
Jean-Ricner Bellegarde (Wolves) replaces
Jhon Arias.

Hugo Bueno just cannot continue due to injury
and has to be substituted. David Moller
Wolfe (Wolves) replaces him.

The referee stops play so that a substitution
can be made and Sasa Kalajdzic (Wolves)
comes onto the pitch for Hee-Chan Hwang.

Here is a change. Beto is going off and
David Moyes gives the last tactical orders
to Thierno Barry (Everton).

Substitution. Idrissa Gueye walks off the
pitch and Tim Iroegbunam (Everton) comes
on as a substitute.

Goal! Rodrigo Gomes (Wolves) finds himself
some space inside the box to get on the
end of a pass from David Moller Wolfe, then
sends the ball into the roof of the net.
2:3.

That's the end of the game for Jack Grealish,
who is replaced by Carlos Alcaraz (Everton).

The referee stops play so that a substitution
can be made and Iliman Ndiaye leaves the
pitch and Seamus Coleman (Everton) comes
on.

Enzo Maresca is forced to make a change.
Liam Delap is unable to continue due to
injury, Tyrique George (Chelsea) comes on.

The referee looks satisfied after his VAR
review and duly disallows the goal due to
a foul. The Fulham players look gutted.

Moises Caicedo (Chelsea) is booked after
bringing down an opponent. Robert Jones
had an easy-decision to make.

Joao Pedro (Chelsea) manages to rise above
the opponent's defenders to meet the well-taken
corner kick with his head. His effort goes
inside the right post. What a finish!

GOAL! Enzo Fernandez (Chelsea) takes a real
chance, but his penalty strike right into
the middle of the net fools Bernd Leno in
goal.

The manager makes a subsitution with Raul
Jimenez (Fulham) coming on for Rodrigo Muniz.

Marco Silva has decided to introduce fresh
legs, with Harry Wilson (Fulham) replacing
Timothy Castagne.

Substitution. Antonee Robinson (Fulham)
receives a signal from the referee and is
now allowed to enter the pitch as Ryan Sessegnon
walks off.

Marco Silva decides to make a substitution.
Joshua King will be replaced by Emile Smith
Rowe (Fulham).

It is time for a substitution. Jamie Gittens
(Chelsea) is on for Estêvão.

Alex Iwobi (Fulham) is rightly booked by
the referee because it could not have been
anything other than a yellow card.

Enzo Maresca has decided to make a change.
Andrey Santos (Chelsea) replaces Tyrique
George.

Substitution. Reece James (Chelsea) has
come on for Pedro Neto.

Alex Iwobi will be replaced by Adama Traore
(Fulham).

This yellow card was deserved. The tackle
by Andrey Santos (Chelsea) was quite harsh
and Robert Jones didn't hesitate to show
him a yellow card.

This is a yellow card! Sasa Lukic (Fulham)
is not happy with the decision, but from
our point of view it was clear.

Ryan Gravenberch (Liverpool) has tested
the patience of referee Simon Hooper and
goes into the book for a previous late challenge.

This is a yellow card! Ibrahima Konate (Liverpool)
is not happy with the decision, but from
our point of view it was clear.

What a beautiful moment! Ryan Gravenberch
(Liverpool) got to the ball and unleashed
a strong shot from distance. It turned out
to be a good decision as his effort found
its way into the bottom left corner. Nick
Pope just shakes his head in disbelief.
The score changes to 0:1.

This yellow card was deserved. The tackle
by Dan Burn (Newcastle Utd) was quite harsh
and Simon Hooper didn't hesitate to show
him a yellow card.

Anthony Gordon (Newcastle Utd) takes out
his opponent with a horrific tackle and
is relieved when the referee only shows
him a yellow card.

Cody Gakpo produces a killer pass to release
Hugo Ekitike (Liverpool), who then unleashes
a low drive from the edge of the box and
scores! The ball goes in off the left post,
leaving the goalkeeper stranded. 0:2!

Whoa! Such gestures are commonly penalised
and Bruno Guimaraes (Newcastle Utd) duly
receives a yellow card.

It's a goal! Bruno Guimaraes (Newcastle
Utd) makes it 1:2. He jumped highest to
connect with a perfect cross from Valentino
Livramento and planted his close-range header
into the bottom right corner. Alisson was
helpless.

Eddie Howe has decided to substitute Sandro
Tonali and he is replaced by Lewis Miley
(Newcastle Utd).

Substitution. Joelinton did his best and
is replaced by Jacob Ramsey (Newcastle Utd).

Eddie Howe has decided to make a change.
William Osula (Newcastle Utd) replaces Harvey
Barnes.

Substitution. Kieran Trippier walks off
the pitch and Lewis Hall (Newcastle Utd)
comes on as a substitute.

Substitution. Florian Wirtz will be replaced
by Conor Bradley (Liverpool).

Arne Slot has decided to introduce fresh
legs, with Federico Chiesa (Liverpool) replacing
Hugo Ekitike.

Malick Thiaw (Newcastle Utd) takes to the
field as the replacement for Fabian Schar,
who couldn’t continue due to his head injury.

The game is interrupted because of a yellow
card that is shown to Conor Bradley (Liverpool).

William Osula (Newcastle Utd) gets on the
end of a long pass that is slotted through
the defence and easily sends the ball into
the bottom left corner!

The referee signals that it is time for
a substitution and Rio Ngumoha (Liverpool)
will replace Cody Gakpo.

Arne Slot prepares a substitution. Curtis
Jones is replaced by Harvey Elliott (Liverpool).

It's in the back of the net! Superb finishing
from Rio Ngumoha (Liverpool). Mohamed Salah
plays a fantastic through ball and finds
Rio Ngumoha (Liverpool), who reacts quickly
to get in front of the goalkeeper and fire
a close-range shot into the right side of
the goal. It's now 2:3.

Bruno Fernandes (Manchester United) misses
the penalty! His poor effort goes well over
the crossbar.

That will be all from Amad Diallo who is
being replaced by the fresh legs of Diogo
Dalot (Manchester United).

Here is a change. Casemiro is going off
and Ruben Amorim gives the last tactical
orders to Benjamin Sesko (Manchester United).

OWN GOAL! Rodrigo Muniz (Fulham) scores
an unlucky own goal after he deflected a
shot which went into his own net! 0:1.

Here comes a substitution. Timothy Castagne
is given a rest as he is replaced by Harry
Wilson (Fulham).

Marco Silva has decided to introduce fresh
legs, with Antonee Robinson (Fulham) replacing
Ryan Sessegnon.

The substitution has been made. Manuel Ugarte
(Manchester United) has replaced Mason Mount.

Marco Silva prepares a substitution. Joshua
King is replaced by Emile Smith Rowe (Fulham).

Rodrigo Muniz will be replaced by Raul Jimenez
(Fulham).

What a goal! Alex Iwobi plays it to Emile
Smith Rowe (Fulham), who finds himself unmarked
inside the box and slots a first-time shot
past Altay Bayindir into the left side of
the goal. 1:1.
The yellow card goes to Sasa Lukic (Fulham).

Substitution. Ayden Heaven (Manchester United)
replaces Leny Yoro.

Ruben Amorim has decided to substitute Luke
Shaw and he is replaced by Harry Maguire
(Manchester United).

Maxence Lacroix (Crystal Palace) makes a
bad challenge and receives a yellow card.
The referee had no doubt.

It's a goal! Ismaila Sarr (Crystal Palace)
scores with a brilliant shot into the bottom
right corner after being released inside
the box by a superb lofted pass from Daniel
Munoz. The score is now 1:0.

That's a clear yellow card. Matz Sels (Nottingham)
goes into the book.

Tyrick Mitchell (Crystal Palace) goes into
the referee's book. Yellow card.

Goal! Dan Ndoye shows great vision to find
Callum Hudson-Odoi (Nottingham) with a cheeky
pass inside the box, and his first-time
shot is precise and sails into the bottom
right corner. 1:1.

The referee stops play so that a substitution
can be made and Justin Devenny leaves the
pitch and Romain Esse (Crystal Palace) comes
on.

Ola Aina (Nottingham) receives a yellow
card for talking out of turn to the referee.

It's time for a substitution. That's the
last involvement from Dan Ndoye as he is
replaced by Arnaud Kalimuendo (Nottingham).

Nuno Espirito Santo has decided to make
a change. James McAtee (Nottingham) replaces
Callum Hudson-Odoi.

Here comes a substitution. Morgan Gibbs-White
is given a rest as he is replaced by Omari
Hutchinson (Nottingham).

Here is a change. Adam Wharton is going
off and Oliver Glasner gives the last tactical
orders to Jefferson Lerma (Crystal Palace).

Will Hughes (Crystal Palace) is booked after
bringing down an opponent. Anthony Taylor
had an easy-decision to make.

The referee stops play so that a substitution
can be made and Ryan Yates (Nottingham)
replaces Ibrahim Sangare.

Nuno Espirito Santo prepares a substitution.
Chris Wood is replaced by Igor Jesus (Nottingham).

The substitution is prepared. Odsonne Edouard
(Crystal Palace) joins the action as a substitute,
replacing Jean-Philippe Mateta.

Murillo (Nottingham) has tested the patience
of referee Anthony Taylor and goes into
the book for a previous late challenge.

It's 1:0! Jack Grealish feeds Iliman Ndiaye
(Everton) inside the box, who is unmarked
and buries the ball in the bottom right
corner.

Maxim De Cuyper (Brighton) is cautioned
by the referee, who shows him a yellow card.

Tim Iroegbunam (Everton) makes it easy for
the referee to show him a yellow card.

This is a yellow card! Mats Wieffer (Brighton)
is not happy with the decision, but from
our point of view it was clear.

Fabian Hurzeler makes a half-time substitution.
Jack Hinshelwood (Brighton) comes on in
place of Carlos Baleba.

A wonderful pass found its target. James
Garner (Everton) received it well and shot
from about 20 metres out. He did really
well to send the ball past the goalkeeper
and into the bottom left corner.

James Garner (Everton) is yellow-carded
for breaking the rules of the game.

Substitution. Iliman Ndiaye walks off the
pitch and Carlos Alcaraz (Everton) comes
on as a substitute.

David Moyes decides to make a substitution.
Thierno Barry will be replaced by Beto (Everton).

Maxim De Cuyper comes off the pitch to be
replaced by Ferdi Kadioglu (Brighton).

Fabian Hurzeler prepares a substitution.
Yasin Ayari is replaced by Diego Gomez (Brighton).

The referee stops play so that a substitution
can be made and Dwight McNeil is coming
onto the pitch as Tim Iroegbunam (Everton)
cannot continue after picking up an injury.

Jordan Pickford anticipates the direction
of the penalty by Danny Welbeck (Brighton).
He attempted to put the ball into the bottom
right corner, but the goalkeeper was there
in time to deny him.

Mats Wieffer goes off the pitch and Brajan
Gruda (Brighton) comes on.

Kiernan Dewsbury-Hall (Everton) goes in
the referee's notebook after being shown
a yellow card.
Caution goes to Ferdi Kadioglu (Brighton).

The referee signals that it is time for
a substitution and Harrison Armstrong (Everton)
comes onto the pitch so that Jack Grealish
can be given a rest.

Beto (Everton) violates the laws of the
game and is shown a deserved yellow card
by the referee.

Jayden Bogle (Leeds) is booked after bringing
down an opponent. Jarred Gillett had an
easy-decision to make.

Gooal! Declan Rice takes over corner duties.
Jurrien Timber (Arsenal) gets his head on
the ball from the corner and puts it into
the right side of the net. 1:0.

Mikel Arteta is forced to make an unplanned
substitution as Martin Odegaard suffers
an injury and Ethan Nwaneri (Arsenal) comes
on.

Goal - 2:0! Jurrien Timber laid the ball
off to Bukayo Saka (Arsenal), who unleashed
a strong shot from close range into the
back of the net, leaving the goalkeeper
helpless.

An amazing individual effort from Viktor
Gyökeres (Arsenal) ends with a strike from
inside the penalty area. He sends the ball
precisely into the bottom left corner and
makes it 3:0. Lucas Perri was helpless.

Bukayo Saka (Arsenal) is being substituted
because of an injury. Mikel Arteta sends
Leandro Trossard on the pitch.

Goal! Jurrien Timber (Arsenal) pounced on
a loose ball inside the box and beats the
goalkeeper with a shot into the middle of
the net. He makes it 4:0.

A substitution has been made. Ao Tanaka
is replaced by Sean Longstaff (Leeds).

Daniel Farke has decided to substitute Joel
Piroe and he is replaced by Lukas Nmecha
(Leeds).

Substitution. Noni Madueke makes way for
Max Dowman (Arsenal).

Here is a change. Riccardo Calafiori is
going off and Mikel Arteta gives the last
tactical orders to Myles Lewis-Skelly (Arsenal).

The game has come to an end for Jurrien
Timber. He has contributed as much as he
could today. He will be replaced by the
fresh legs of Cristhian Mosquera (Arsenal).

That's the end of the game for Daniel James,
who is replaced by Brenden Aaronson (Leeds).

Substitution. Noah Okafor (Leeds) replaces
Wilfried Gnonto.

Jarred Gillett shows a yellow card to Gabriel
Gudmundsson (Leeds) for his blatant foul.

Daniel Farke prepares a substitution. Jayden
Bogle is replaced by Samuel Byram (Leeds).

GOAL! That’s a great strike from the spot
by Viktor Gyökeres (Arsenal) into the left
of the net, giving goalkeeper Lucas Perri
no chance!

Goal! Antoine Semenyo plays it to Marcus
Tavernier (Bournemouth), whose deflected
shot from inside the box goes past the helpless
Jose Sa. 1:0.

This yellow card was deserved. The tackle
by Toti (Wolves) was quite harsh and Thomas
Bramall didn't hesitate to show him a yellow
card.

Ki-Jana Hoever is being substituted because
of an injury. Vitor Pereira sends Jackson
Tchatchoua (Wolves) on the pitch.

The teams are back out for the second half
and here is a change on the pitch. Vitor
Pereira gives a chance to Andre and Jean-Ricner
Bellegarde (Wolves) is off.

Half-time substitution. David Moller Wolfe
(Wolves) will not participate anymore and
Hugo Bueno is coming on.

Toti (Wolves) cannot believe that he has
been told to leave the field of play after
the referee blows his whistle and sends
him off!

Substitution. Santiago Bueno (Wolves) has
come on for Jhon Arias.

Thomas Bramall shows a yellow card to Tyler
Adams (Bournemouth) for his blatant foul.

Alex Scott (Bournemouth) commits a foul
and is shown a yellow card.

Santiago Bueno (Wolves) receives a yellow
card from the referee as expected.

Substitution. David Brooks will be replaced
by Amine Adli (Bournemouth).

Andoni Iraola has decided to make a change.
Ryan Christie (Bournemouth) replaces Alex
Scott.

The manager has decided to make a substitution
and Marcus Tavernier walks off the pitch
to be replaced by Justin Kluivert (Bournemouth).

Vitor Pereira has decided to introduce fresh
legs, with Hee-Chan Hwang (Wolves) replacing
Jorgen Strand Larsen.

Matt Doherty (Wolves) is booked after bringing
down an opponent. Thomas Bramall had an
easy-decision to make.
Joao Gomes (Wolves) receives a yellow card.

Here is a change. Evanilson is going off
and Andoni Iraola gives the last tactical
orders to Eli Junior Kroupi (Bournemouth).

Substitution. James Hill (Bournemouth) in,
Tyler Adams out.

Goal! Dango Ouattara (Brentford) was in
the right place at the right time to get
to the rebound inside the box and gleefully
rifles the ball low into the middle of the
net. It's 1:0.

Unai Emery is forced to make a change. Boubacar
Kamara is not able to carry on due to injury.
He is replaced by Emiliano Buendia (Aston
Villa).

Here comes the VAR verdict. NO GOAL for
Brentford due to a foul in the build-up
play.

Caoimhin Kelleher (Brentford) is punished
with a yellow card for violating the rules.

Amadou Onana (Aston Villa) sees a yellow
card from Tony Harrington after he sent
one of the opposing players to the ground.

The referee allows time for a substitution.
Amadou Onana will be replaced by Donyell
Malen (Aston Villa).

Unai Emery has decided to substitute Lucas
Digne and he is replaced by Ian Maatsen
(Aston Villa).

The referee stops play so that a substitution
can be made and Jordan Henderson trots off
the pitch and is replaced by Frank Onyeka
(Brentford).

Substitution. Lamare Bogarde (Aston Villa)
has come on for John McGinn.

Unai Emery decides to make a substitution.
Emiliano Buendia will be replaced by Evann
Guessand (Aston Villa).

Here comes a substitution. Aaron Hickey
(Brentford) is brought on as a substitute
for Kevin Schade.

Here is a change. Yegor Yarmolyuk is going
off and Keith Andrews gives the last tactical
orders to Mathias Jensen (Brentford).

Tony Harrington shows a yellow card to Lamare
Bogarde (Aston Villa) for a tough tackle.

Substitution. Dango Ouattara is replaced
by Rico Henry (Brentford).

Keith Andrews has decided to make a change.
Kristoffer Ajer (Brentford) replaces Michael
Kayode.

Jenson Seelt (Sunderland) comes onto the
pitch because Daniel Ballard simply cannot
continue any longer after picking up an
injury.

That's a clear yellow card. Simon Adingra
(Sunderland) goes into the book.

Goal! Jaidon Anthony plays a short, square
pass into the path of Josh Cullen (Burnley),
who bends a shot straight into the bottom
right corner to make it 1:0. Fabulous goal!

Chemsdine Talbi comes off the pitch to be
replaced by Patrick Roberts (Sunderland).

Regis Le Bris decides to make a substitution.
Simon Adingra will be replaced by Enzo Le
Fee (Sunderland).

The manager makes a subsitution with Wilson
Isidor (Sunderland) coming on for Eliezer
Mayenda.

Problems for Scott Parker as Lesley Ugochukwu
(Burnley) is not able to play anymore. His
injury is too serious and Josh Laurent replaces
him.

Substitution. Oliver Sonne (Burnley) on
for Jacob Bruun Larsen.

Habib Diarra goes off the pitch and Marc
Guiu (Sunderland) comes on.

Scott Parker has decided to introduce fresh
legs, with Loum Tchaouna (Burnley) replacing
Hannibal Mejbri.

Substitution. Joe Worrall (Burnley) receives
a signal from the referee and is now allowed
to enter the pitch as Maxime Esteve walks
off.

Scott Parker has decided to substitute Lyle
Foster and he is replaced by Zian Flemming
(Burnley).

Josh Cullen passes to Jaidon Anthony (Burnley),
who gets one-on-one with the keeper. His
dummy grounds the keeper and he has a simple
task lifting the ball over him into the
net.

summary.incident:
The manager has been forced to make a substitution
and the injured Rayan Ait Nouri limps off
the pitch to be replaced by Nathan Ake (Manchester
City).

Brennan Johnson (Tottenham) makes it easy
for the referee to show him a yellow card.

Goal! Richarlison provides Brennan Johnson
(Tottenham) with a nice pass inside the
box. It allows him to finish with a strike
into the middle of the goal. 0:1.

Goal! It's a catastrophic error from the
opponent which has gifted a chance to Joao
Palhinha (Tottenham), who rolls the ball
into the back of the net from close range.
0:2.

The referee stops play so that a substitution
can be made and Rayan Cherki trots off the
pitch and is replaced by Bernardo Silva
(Manchester City).

Pep Guardiola prepares a substitution. Omar
Marmoush is replaced by Jeremy Doku (Manchester
City).

Cristian Gabriel Romero (Tottenham) is booked
after bringing down an opponent. Peter Bankes
had an easy-decision to make.

The referee is firm and issues Nico (Manchester
City) a deserved yellow card.

This is a yellow card! Richarlison (Tottenham)
is not happy with the decision, but from
our point of view it was clear.

Here's the change. Oscar Bobb leaves the
pitch and Phil Foden (Manchester City) comes
on as a substitute.

Pep Guardiola decides to make a substitution.
Nico will be replaced by Rodri (Manchester
City).

Thomas Frank has decided to make a change.
Dominic Solanke (Tottenham) replaces Richarlison.

Substitution. Brennan Johnson did his best
and is replaced by Wilson Odobert (Tottenham).

Pedro Porro (Tottenham) is given a fully
deserved yellow card.

Substitution. Lucas Bergvall (Tottenham)
receives a signal from the referee and is
now allowed to enter the pitch as Mohammed
Kudus walks off.

The manager has decided to make a substitution
and Joao Palhinha walks off the pitch to
be replaced by Kevin Danso (Tottenham).

Goal! Lucas Paqueta (West Ham) weaves his
way past opponents, and he unleashes a magnificent
effort from the edge of the box into the
top right corner. Robert Sanchez had no
chance of reaching it. The score is 1:0.

Goal! Marc Cucurella plays the ball into
the area and Joao Pedro (Chelsea) gets on
the end of it to glance a header into the
back of the net. He makes it 1:1.

The goal by West Ham is DISALLOWED on the
advice of the video assistant referee due
to an offside.

Simply glorious! Pedro Neto (Chelsea) wonderfully
timed his run onto a cross and thunders
the ball from deep inside the box into the
top left corner!

Estêvão provides Enzo Fernandez (Chelsea)
with a nice pass inside the box. It allows
him to finish with a low shot into the middle
of the goal.

The need to improve in the second half has
brought about a change. Niclas Fullkrug
comes off for Callum Wilson (West Ham).

The teams are back out for the second half
and here is a change on the pitch. Graham
Potter gives a chance to Freddie Potts and
Jean-Clair Todibo (West Ham) is off.

Goal! Moises Caicedo (Chelsea) seizes on
the loose ball after a huge error from Mads
Hermansen and finds the back of the net
from inside the box. 1:4.

Goal! Trevoh Chalobah (Chelsea) picks up
the ball inside the box, finds himself in
a good position and fires in a shot which
is deflected past Mads Hermansen. He makes
it 1:5.

The game has come to an end for Liam Delap.
He has contributed as much as he could today.
He will be replaced by the fresh legs of
Andrey Santos (Chelsea).

Substitution. Reece James (Chelsea) has
come on for Malo Gusto.

Enzo Maresca decides to make a substitution.
Marc Cucurella will be replaced by Jorrel
Hato (Chelsea).

The referee allows time for a substitution.
Trevoh Chalobah will be replaced by Wesley
Fofana (Chelsea).

Substitution. Kyle Walker-Peters (West Ham)
in, Tomas Soucek out.

Jamie Gittens (Chelsea) joins the action
as a substitute, replacing Estêvão.

Michael Oliver shows a yellow card to Jorrel
Hato (Chelsea), who isn't surprised as the
tackle was really hard and late.

This yellow card was deserved. The tackle
by Tim Iroegbunam (Everton) was quite harsh
and Chris Kavanagh didn't hesitate to show
him a yellow card.

Carlos Alcaraz (Everton) gets a yellow card.
The referee Chris Kavanagh made the right
call.

Substitution. Brenden Aaronson (Leeds) has
come on for Wilfried Gnonto.

Here is a change. Tim Iroegbunam is going
off and David Moyes gives the last tactical
orders to Jack Grealish (Everton).

Daniel Farke has decided to make a change.
Lukas Nmecha (Leeds) replaces Joel Piroe.

That will be all from Daniel James who is
being replaced by the fresh legs of Jack
Harrison (Leeds).

The substitution is prepared. Ilia Gruev
(Leeds) joins the action as a substitute,
replacing Ethan Ampadu.

Goal! Lukas Nmecha (Leeds) puts the ball
into the bottom right corner past the outstretched
arm of Jordan Pickford.

Today's match ends for Carlos Alcaraz who
will be replaced by Thierno Barry (Everton).

The game has come to an end for Ao Tanaka.
He has contributed as much as he could today.
He will be replaced by the fresh legs of
Sean Longstaff (Leeds).

Goal! The corner is whipped in and Riccardo
Calafiori (Arsenal) is in the right place
at the right time, planting his header perfectly
into the right side of the goal. He makes
it 0:1.

Riccardo Calafiori (Arsenal) commits a foul
and is shown a yellow card without any hesitation
from the referee.

We are about to witness a substitution.
Amad Diallo (Manchester United) is replacing
Diogo Dalot.

The referee allows time for a substitution.
Viktor Gyokeres will be replaced by Kai
Havertz (Arsenal).

Here is a change. Gabriel Martinelli is
going off and Mikel Arteta gives the last
tactical orders to Noni Madueke (Arsenal).

Casemiro comes off the pitch to be replaced
by Manuel Ugarte (Manchester United).

The referee signals that it is time for
a substitution and Benjamin Sesko (Manchester
United) will replace Mason Mount.

Jurrien Timber (Arsenal) comes onto the
pitch after Ben White signals to the bench
that he cannot continue any longer after
picking up an injury.

Mikel Arteta has decided to make a change.
Myles Lewis-Skelly (Arsenal) replaces Riccardo
Calafiori.

The referee signals a substitution. Harry
Maguire (Manchester United) is brought on
as a substitute for Luke Shaw.

The substitution is prepared. Mikel Merino
(Arsenal) joins the action as a substitute,
replacing Declan Rice.

Patrick Dorgu (Manchester United) has tested
the patience of referee Simon Hooper and
goes into the book for a previous late challenge.

It's like he was asking for a caution. David
Raya (Arsenal) receives a yellow card.

Booking. Jurrien Timber (Arsenal) receives
a caution from the referee.

Simon Hooper shows a yellow card to Myles
Lewis-Skelly (Arsenal) for his blatant foul.

The goal by Crystal Palace won’t count as
referee Darren England disallows the goal
on the advice of the video assistant referee.

Reece James (Chelsea) shouldn't be surprised
it's a yellow from the ref, who cooled the
situation down well.

Yellow card. Daniel Munoz (Crystal Palace)
goes into the referee's book after a bad
challenge.

Darren England shows a yellow card to Jean-Philippe
Mateta (Crystal Palace) for his blatant
foul.

This yellow card was deserved. The tackle
by Will Hughes (Crystal Palace) was quite
harsh and Darren England didn't hesitate
to show him a yellow card.

The manager makes a subsitution with Estevao
(Chelsea) coming on for Jamie Gittens.

We are about to witness a substitution.
Jefferson Lerma (Crystal Palace) is replacing
Will Hughes.

Substitution. Joao Pedro makes way for Liam
Delap (Chelsea).

Estevao (Chelsea) has tested the patience
of referee Darren England and goes into
the book for a previous late challenge.

The referee stops play so that a substitution
can be made and Malo Gusto (Chelsea) replaces
Reece James.

Here is a change. Enzo Fernandez is going
off and Enzo Maresca gives the last tactical
orders to Andrey Santos (Chelsea).

The manager has decided to make a substitution
and Eberechi Eze walks off the pitch to
be replaced by Justin Devenny (Crystal Palace).

Goal! Chris Wood (Nottingham) unleashes
a first-time shot from inside the box and
beats the goalkeeper inside the left post.
1:0.

Goal! Morgan Gibbs-White swings the ball
deep into the box and finds Dan Ndoye (Nottingham)
unmarked, and his close-range header flies
past the keeper into the top left corner.
2:0.

Goal! Elliot Anderson slips in Chris Wood
(Nottingham) for a one-on-one with the keeper,
and he simply dinks the ball over him into
the net.

Keith Andrews has decided to make a substitution
during the half-time break. Kevin Schade
comes on the pitch for Antoni Milambo (Brentford).

Peter Bankes shows a yellow card to Nathan
Michael Collins (Brentford) for a tough
tackle.

Neco Williams (Nottingham) is shown a yellow
card for a late challenge.

Substitution. Mathias Jensen walks off the
pitch and Jordan Henderson (Brentford) comes
on as a substitute.

Keith Andrews prepares a substitution. Keane
Lewis-Potter is replaced by Frank Onyeka
(Brentford).

GOAL! Igor Thiago (Brentford) strikes the
penalty low down the middle and scores after
the ball glances off the leg of Matz Sels.

A substitution has been made. Chris Wood
goes off and Igor Jesus (Nottingham) comes
on.

Nuno Espirito Santo has decided to make
a change. Jota Silva (Nottingham) replaces
Dan Ndoye.

Nuno Espirito Santo has decided to introduce
fresh legs, with Ryan Yates (Nottingham)
replacing Morgan Gibbs-White.

Rico Henry comes off the pitch to be replaced
by Aaron Hickey (Brentford).

Aaron Hickey (Brentford) is booked after
bringing down an opponent. Peter Bankes
had an easy-decision to make.

It's in the back of the net! Rico Lewis
sprays a pass out to Erling Haaland (Manchester
City), and he has an easy job to slot the
ball into an empty net. The score is 0:1.

GOAL! Superb work from Oscar Bobb, who plays
a vital role in the build-up. He squares
it to Tijjani Reijnders (Manchester City),
who beats Jose Sa with a brilliant shot
into the bottom right corner. 0:2.

Tijjani Reijnders (Manchester City) can't
expect anything else than a yellow card
for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is.
Jarred Gillett didn't think twice about
pulling it out of his pocket.

Goal! Erling Haaland (Manchester City) shows
good awareness inside the box as he latches
on to a brilliant pass and fires a first-time
shot into the bottom left corner. Tijjani
Reijnders assisted in the goal. 0:3.

Here's the change. Rico Lewis leaves the
pitch and Matheus Nunes (Manchester City)
comes on as a substitute.

Pep Guardiola has decided to make a change.
Omar Marmoush (Manchester City) replaces
Jeremy Doku.

Substitution. Nico O'Reilly (Manchester
City) replaces Bernardo Silva.

Jarred Gillett shows a yellow card to Matt
Doherty (Wolves), who isn't surprised as
the tackle was really hard and late.

Hugo Bueno (Wolves) joins the action as
a substitute, replacing David Moller Wolfe.

Here is a change. Andre is going off and
Vitor Pereira gives the last tactical orders
to Fernando Lopez (Wolves).

Here comes a substitution. Rodrigo Gomes
(Wolves) is brought on as a substitute for
Ki-Jana Hoever.

Vitor Pereira has decided to introduce fresh
legs, with Jhon Arias (Wolves) replacing
Jean-Ricner Bellegarde.

Substitution. Erling Haaland leaves the
pitch and is replaced by Rayan Cherki (Manchester
City).

Rayan Cherki (Manchester City) unleashes
a ferocious shot from just outside the penalty
area and the ball goes into the left side
of the goal!

Nico O'Reilly (Manchester City) has to be
very careful for the rest of the match after
receiving a yellow card from the referee
for a bad tackle on an opponent.

A substitution has been made. Jorgen Strand
Larsen is replaced by Hee-Chan Hwang (Wolves).

Pep Guardiola prepares a substitution. John
Stones is replaced by Abdukodir Khusanov
(Manchester City).

After what seems an eternity, referee Samuel
Barrott decides the ball went out of play
after using VAR to review the goal! NO GOAL
for Brighton, play to continue.

Booking. Calvin Bassey (Fulham) receives
a caution from the referee.

GOAL! That’s a great strike from the spot
by Matt O'Riley (Brighton) into the left
of the net, giving goalkeeper Bernd Leno
no chance!

Kaoru Mitoma (Brighton) earns the yellow
card.

Marco Silva has decided to substitute Sander
Berge and he is replaced by Tom Cairney
(Fulham).

The game has come to an end for Raul Jimenez.
He has contributed as much as he could today.
He will be replaced by the fresh legs of
Rodrigo Muniz (Fulham).

Substitution. Alex Iwobi will be replaced
by Adama Traore (Fulham).

Carlos Baleba will be replaced by Diego
Gomez (Brighton).

Fabian Hurzeler has decided to introduce
fresh legs, with Danny Welbeck (Brighton)
replacing Georginio Rutter.

The referee signals that it is time for
a substitution and Ferdi Kadioglu (Brighton)
is coming onto the pitch as Yankuba Minteh
cannot continue after picking up an injury.

Samuel Barrott shows a yellow card to Ferdi
Kadioglu (Brighton), who isn't surprised
as the tackle was really hard and late.

Marco Silva decides to make a substitution.
Joshua King will be replaced by Emile Smith
Rowe (Fulham).

Samuel Barrott shows the yellow card to
Diego Gomez (Brighton) for a heavy challenge.

The referee signals that it is time for
a substitution and Brajan Gruda (Brighton)
will replace Kaoru Mitoma.

Here is a change. Jorge Cuenca is going
off and Marco Silva gives the last tactical
orders to Timothy Castagne (Fulham).

The substitution is prepared. James Milner
(Brighton) joins the action as a substitute,
replacing Matt O'Riley.

A yellow card for a tackle by Tom Cairney
(Fulham). Samuel Barrott doesn't hesitate
at all to make this decision.

Rodrigo Muniz (Fulham) gets on the end of
the corner kick deep inside the box and
beats the keeper with a precise close-range
shot into the bottom right corner.

Rodrigo Muniz (Fulham) picks up a yellow
card for an infringement.

Regis Le Bris is forced to make a change.
Jenson Seelt (Sunderland) is unable to continue
due to injury, Omar Alderete comes on.

Goal! Omar Alderete picks out Eliezer Mayenda
(Sunderland) in the box with a decent cross,
and he scores in the left side of the goal
with a header from close range. 1:0.

Max Kilman (West Ham) fouls his opponent
and receives a yellow card from the referee,
but he is clearly not happy with the decision.

A substitution has been made. Guido Rodriguez
goes off and Callum Wilson (West Ham) comes
on.

Graham Potter decides to make a substitution.
James Ward-Prowse will be replaced by Tomas
Soucek (West Ham).

Goal! Simon Adingra hands Daniel Ballard
(Sunderland) the simplest of tasks from
close range after the cross evaded the keeper,
and he makes no mistake with his header
into the left side of the goal. 2:0.

The referee stops play so that a substitution
can be made and Simon Adingra trots off
the pitch and is replaced by Enzo Le Fee
(Sunderland).

Here is a change. Eliezer Mayenda is going
off and Regis Le Bris gives the last tactical
orders to Wilson Isidor (Sunderland).

Substitution. Jean-Clair Todibo will be
replaced by Andrew Irving (West Ham).

Wilson Isidor (Sunderland) finishes his
beautiful individual effort with a superb
strike from inside the box. Mads Hermansen
is just a bystander as the ball flies into
bottom right corner. The score is 3:0.

Substitution. Chemsdine Talbi walks off
the pitch and Christopher Rigg (Sunderland)
comes on as a substitute.

home_team:
Hjelde L. F.
Achilles Tendon Injury

summary.incident:
It's a goal! Richarlison (Tottenham) shows
off his superb ability as he volleys the
ball from inside the box into the bottom
left corner. The assist goes to Mohammed
Kudus and the score changes to 1:0.

What a GOAL! The lofted pass into the box
is expertly and acrobatically dispatched
into the net by Richarlison (Tottenham).
2:0.

It's time for a substitution. That's the
last involvement from Josh Laurent as he
is replaced by Lesley Ugochukwu (Burnley).

Scott Parker has decided to substitute Hannibal
Mejbri and he is replaced by Jacob Bruun
Larsen (Burnley).

Goal Brennan Johnson (Tottenham)! Brennan
Johnson (Tottenham) was put through by Pape
Matar Sarr and he showed brilliant composure
inside the box to fire into the bottom right
corner. 3:0.

The referee signals that it is time for
a substitution and Rodrigo Bentancur (Tottenham)
comes onto the pitch so that Archie Gray
can be given a rest.

Thomas Frank has decided to introduce fresh
legs, with Dominic Solanke (Tottenham) replacing
Richarlison.

The referee signals a substitution. Zian
Flemming (Burnley) is brought on as a substitute
for Lyle Foster.

Scott Parker prepares a substitution. Oliver
Sonne is replaced by Loum Tchaouna (Burnley).

Substitution. Lucas Bergvall makes his way
off the pitch and Joao Palhinha (Tottenham)
comes on as his replacement.

The substitution has been made. Wilson Odobert
(Tottenham) has replaced Brennan Johnson.

Marcus Edwards (Burnley) joins the action
as a substitute, replacing Jaidon Anthony.

Here is a change. Mohammed Kudus is going
off and Thomas Frank gives the last tactical
orders to Mathys Tel (Tottenham).

away_team:
Manuel Hedilazio B.
Achilles Tendon Injury

summary.incident:
The referee gives a yellow card to Joelinton
(Newcastle Utd).

Craig Pawson shows the yellow card to Boubacar
Kamara (Aston Villa) for a heavy challenge.

Craig Pawson shows a red card with no hesitation.
Ezri Konsa (Aston Villa) can have an early
bath and think about his challenge.

Anthony Elanga will be replaced by Jacob
Murphy (Newcastle Utd).

Here is a change. Joelinton is going off
and Eddie Howe gives the last tactical orders
to Lewis Miley (Newcastle Utd).

The referee stops play so that a substitution
can be made and John McGinn trots off the
pitch and is replaced by Donyell Malen (Aston
Villa).

Eddie Howe decides to make a substitution.
Harvey Barnes will be replaced by William
Osula (Newcastle Utd).

The referee is firm and issues David Brooks
(Bournemouth) a deserved yellow card.

Goal! Hugo Ekitike (Liverpool) pounced on
a loose ball inside the penalty area and
beats the goalkeeper with a shot into the
bottom right corner. He makes it 1:0.

Milos Kerkez (Liverpool) gives the referee
no choice but to show him a yellow card.

Goal! Cody Gakpo (Liverpool) finds some
space for a shot from the edge of the box
and his attempt goes low inside the right
post. Fantastic finish.

The game has come to an end for Jeremie
Frimpong. He has contributed as much as
he could today. He will be replaced by the
fresh legs of Wataru Endo (Liverpool).

Arne Slot has decided to make a change.
Andrew Robertson (Liverpool) replaces Milos
Kerkez.

Goal! Antoine Semenyo (Bournemouth) pounced
on a loose ball inside the box and beats
the goalkeeper with a low shot into the
middle of the net. He makes it 2:1.

Arne Slot has decided to introduce fresh
legs, with Curtis Jones (Liverpool) replacing
Alexis Mac Allister.

It's time for a substitution. That's the
last involvement from Hugo Ekitike as he
is replaced by Joe Gomez (Liverpool).

Substitution. Hamed Junior Traore (Bournemouth)
has come on for Alex Scott.

Antoine Semenyo (Bournemouth) finds the
back of the net with a strike from the edge
of the penalty box, with the ball finding
the bottom right corner of the goal.

Evanilson (Bournemouth) is literally asking
for a yellow card with his behaviour. The
referee agrees and books him.

A substitution has been made. Florian Wirtz
goes off and Federico Chiesa (Liverpool)
comes on.

Andoni Iraola decides to make a substitution.
David Brooks will be replaced by Ben Winterburn
(Bournemouth).

Goal! Federico Chiesa (Liverpool) pounced
on a loose ball inside the box and beats
the goalkeeper with a shot inside the right
post. He makes it 3:2.

Adam Smith goes off the pitch and James
Hill (Bournemouth) comes on.

Andoni Iraola prepares a substitution. Tyler
Adams is replaced by Eli Junior Kroupi (Bournemouth).

What a beauty from just outside the box!
Mohamed Salah (Liverpool) lashed the ball
with incredible pace and power into the
bottom right corner.
